trans-unit.source: About secure cross-premises connectivity for virtual networks | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: About secure cross-premises connectivity for virtual networks | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the types of secure cross-premises connections for virtual networks, including site-to-site, point-to-site, and ExpressRoute connections.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the types of secure cross-premises connections for virtual networks, including site-to-site, point-to-site, and ExpressRoute connections.

trans-unit.source: About secure cross-premises connectivity for virtual networks
trans-unit.target: About secure cross-premises connectivity for virtual networks

trans-unit.source: If you want to connect your on-premises sites securely to a virtual network, there are three options available: [Site-to-site](#site-to-site-connections), [Point-to-site](#point-to-site-connections), and [ExpressRoute](#expressroute-connections).
trans-unit.target: If you want to connect your on-premises sites securely to a virtual network, there are three options available: [Site-to-site](#site-to-site-connections), [Point-to-site](#point-to-site-connections), and [ExpressRoute](#expressroute-connections).

trans-unit.source: The option you choose can depend on a variety of considerations, such as:
trans-unit.target: The option you choose can depend on a variety of considerations, such as:

trans-unit.source: What kind of throughput does your solution require?
trans-unit.target: What kind of throughput does your solution require?

trans-unit.source: Do you want to communicate over the public Internet via secure VPN, or over a private connection?
trans-unit.target: Do you want to communicate over the public Internet via secure VPN, or over a private connection?

trans-unit.source: Do you have a public IP address available to use?
trans-unit.target: Do you have a public IP address available to use?

trans-unit.source: Are you planning to use a VPN device?
trans-unit.target: Are you planning to use a VPN device?

trans-unit.source: Are you connecting just a few computers, or do you want a persistent connection for your site?
trans-unit.target: Are you connecting just a few computers, or do you want a persistent connection for your site?

trans-unit.source: What type of VPN gateway is required for the solution you want to create?
trans-unit.target: What type of VPN gateway is required for the solution you want to create?

trans-unit.source: The table below can help you decide the best connectivity option for your solution.
trans-unit.target: The table below can help you decide the best connectivity option for your solution.

trans-unit.source: Static – We support policy—based (static routing) and route-based (dynamic routing VPN)
trans-unit.target: Static – We support policy—based (static routing) and route-based (dynamic routing VPN)

trans-unit.source: Prototyping, dev / test / lab scenarios for cloud services and virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Prototyping, dev / test / lab scenarios for cloud services and virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Dev / test / lab scenarios and small scale production workloads for cloud services and virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Dev / test / lab scenarios and small scale production workloads for cloud services and virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Access to all Azure services (validated list), Enterprise-class and mission critical workloads, Backup, Big Data, Azure as a DR site
trans-unit.target: Access to all Azure services (validated list), Enterprise-class and mission critical workloads, Backup, Big Data, Azure as a DR site

trans-unit.source: Access to all Azure services (validated list), Enterprise-class and mission critical workloads, Backup, Big Data, Azure as a DR site
trans-unit.target: Access to all Azure services (validated list), Enterprise-class and mission critical workloads, Backup, Big Data, Azure as a DR site

trans-unit.source: A site-to-site VPN allows you to create a secure connection between your on-premises site and your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: A site-to-site VPN allows you to create a secure connection between your on-premises site and your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: To create a site-to-site connection, a VPN device that is located on your on-premises network is configured to create a secure connection with the Azure VPN Gateway.
trans-unit.target: To create a site-to-site connection, a VPN device that is located on your on-premises network is configured to create a secure connection with the Azure VPN Gateway.

trans-unit.source: Once the connection is created, resources on your local network and resources located in your virtual network can communicate directly and securely.
trans-unit.target: Once the connection is created, resources on your local network and resources located in your virtual network can communicate directly and securely.

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site connections do not require you to establish a separate connection for each client computer on your local network to access resources in the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site connections do not require you to establish a separate connection for each client computer on your local network to access resources in the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You want to create a hybrid solution.
trans-unit.target: You want to create a hybrid solution.

trans-unit.source: You want a connection between your on-premises location and your virtual network without requiring client-side configurations.
trans-unit.target: You want a connection between your on-premises location and your virtual network without requiring client-side configurations.

trans-unit.source: You want a connection that is persistent.
trans-unit.target: You want a connection that is persistent.

trans-unit.source: The on-premises VPN device must have an Internet-facing IPv4 IP address.
trans-unit.target: The on-premises VPN device must have an Internet-facing IPv4 IP address.

trans-unit.source: This cannot be behind a NAT.
trans-unit.target: This cannot be behind a NAT.

trans-unit.source: You must have VPN device that is compatible.
trans-unit.target: You must have VPN device that is compatible.

trans-unit.source: The VPN device you use must be compatible with the gateway type that is required for your solution.
trans-unit.target: The VPN device you use must be compatible with the gateway type that is required for your solution.

trans-unit.source: The Gateway SKU will also impact aggregate throughput.
trans-unit.target: The Gateway SKU will also impact aggregate throughput.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring a site-to-site VPN gateway connection, see [Configure a virtual network with a site-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring a site-to-site VPN gateway connection, see [Configure a virtual network with a site-to-site VPN connection](vpn-gateway-site-to-site-create.md).

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a site-to-site VPN gateway connection using RRAS, see [Configure a site-to-site VPN using Windows Server 2012 Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn636917.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a site-to-site VPN gateway connection using RRAS, see [Configure a site-to-site VPN using Windows Server 2012 Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn636917.aspx).

trans-unit.source: A point-to-site VPN also allows you to create a secure connection to your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: A point-to-site VPN also allows you to create a secure connection to your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: In a point-to-site configuration, the connection is configured individually on each client computer that you want to connect to the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: In a point-to-site configuration, the connection is configured individually on each client computer that you want to connect to the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site connections do not require a VPN device.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site connections do not require a VPN device.

trans-unit.source: This type of connection uses a VPN client that you install on each client computer.
trans-unit.target: This type of connection uses a VPN client that you install on each client computer.

trans-unit.source: The VPN is established by manually starting the connection from the on-premises client computer.
trans-unit.target: The VPN is established by manually starting the connection from the on-premises client computer.

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site and site-to-site configurations can exist concurrently, but unlike site-to-site connections, point-to-site connections cannot be configured concurrently with an ExpressRoute connection to the same virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site and site-to-site configurations can exist concurrently, but unlike site-to-site connections, point-to-site connections cannot be configured concurrently with an ExpressRoute connection to the same virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You only want to configure a few clients to connect to a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You only want to configure a few clients to connect to a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: You want to connect to your virtual network from a remote location.
trans-unit.target: You want to connect to your virtual network from a remote location.

trans-unit.source: For example, connecting from a coffee shop or a conference venue.
trans-unit.target: For example, connecting from a coffee shop or a conference venue.

trans-unit.source: You have a site-to-site connection, but have some clients that need to connect from a remote location.
trans-unit.target: You have a site-to-site connection, but have some clients that need to connect from a remote location.

trans-unit.source: You do not have access to a VPN device that meets the minimum requirements for a site-to-site connection.
trans-unit.target: You do not have access to a VPN device that meets the minimum requirements for a site-to-site connection.

trans-unit.source: You do not have an Internet facing IPv4 IP address for your VPN device.
trans-unit.target: You do not have an Internet facing IPv4 IP address for your VPN device.

trans-unit.source: For more information about configuring a point-to-site connection, see [Configure a point-to-site VPN connection to a virtual network](vpn-gateway-point-to-site-create.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about configuring a point-to-site connection, see [Configure a point-to-site VPN connection to a virtual network](vpn-gateway-point-to-site-create.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure ExpressRoute lets you create private connections between Azure datacenters and infrastructure that’s on your premises or in a co-location environment.
trans-unit.target: Azure ExpressRoute lets you create private connections between Azure datacenters and infrastructure that’s on your premises or in a co-location environment.

trans-unit.source: ExpressRoute connections do not go over the public Internet and offer more reliability, faster speeds, lower latencies and higher security than typical connections over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: ExpressRoute connections do not go over the public Internet and offer more reliability, faster speeds, lower latencies and higher security than typical connections over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, using ExpressRoute connections to transfer data between on-premises and Azure can also yield significant cost benefits.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, using ExpressRoute connections to transfer data between on-premises and Azure can also yield significant cost benefits.

trans-unit.source: With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Azure at an ExpressRoute location (Exchange Provider facility) or directly connect to Azure from your existing WAN network (such as a MPLS VPN) provided by a network service provider.
trans-unit.target: With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Azure at an ExpressRoute location (Exchange Provider facility) or directly connect to Azure from your existing WAN network (such as a MPLS VPN) provided by a network service provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information about ExpressRoute, see the [ExpressRoute technical overview](../expressroute/expressroute-introduction.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about ExpressRoute, see the [ExpressRoute technical overview](../expressroute/expressroute-introduction.md).

trans-unit.source: See the [ExpressRoute FAQ](../expressroute/expressroute-faqs.md) and the [VPN Gateway FAQ](vpn-gateway-vpn-faq.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the [ExpressRoute FAQ](../expressroute/expressroute-faqs.md) and the [VPN Gateway FAQ](vpn-gateway-vpn-faq.md) for more information.
